thread.title: J.K. Rowling shuts down ex-fan who burned 'Harry Potter' books
thread.title_full: J.K. Rowling shuts down ex-fan who burned 'Harry Potter' books

author: NICOLE BITETTE
title: J.K. Rowling shuts down ex-fan who burned 'Harry Potter' books
text:
J.K. Rowling shuts down ex-fan who burned 'Harry Potter' books New York Daily News 11 hrs ago NICOLE BITETTE Click to expand Replay Video Madonna: By the Numbers Madonna is one of the most popular recording artists of all-time. Let's take a look at some of the amazing facts and figures behind the Queen of Pop. Wired 'Stranger Things' Actor's Medical Condition Is Written Into Series The young cast of Stranger Things stole the hearts of viewers last summer when the show aired on Netflix. The cast is having the time of their lives riding out the success at award shows where they are being crowned winners. However, one star of the show has a surprising condition that was written into the script. Gaten Matarazzo became a fan favorite thanks to his charming and gregarious character Dustin. In the show, Dustin has an unusual genetic disorder where his teeth won't fully grow in. Inside Edition 14 Celebrities You Didn't Know Were Refugees While there are 21 million refugees worldwide, here is a list of 14 of them you probably know such as Mila Kunis, Regina Spektor, Albert Einstein, and MIA. What You Didn't Know About the Iconic Film ETonline 3:31 The red carpet for the Screen Actors Guild awards gets rolled out Reuters 1:08 Stars get animated on SAG Awards red carpet CNN 1:05 Time Magazine's Cover Trolls Trump in Epic Way Buzz60 1:14 How Australian Is Chris Hemsworth? Condé Nast Traveler 1:35 Flashback: Alfonso Ribeiro dances the Carlton from 'Fresh Prince' TODAY 0:52 UP NEXT J.K. Rowling just cast a spell on her angry ex-fans.
The famous British author fired back at some former fans who decided to burn her "Harry Potter" books once learning of her negative feelings towards Donald Trump.
"@jk_rowling just burned all my Harry Potter books after being a fan for 17 years. The Phils Stone was one of the first books I EVER read," one outraged Twitter user wrote. "I'm upset it has to be that way.. You embarrassed me, disgusted me, and I will never read your work again #ThankyouFor17Years"
© Provided by New York Daily News J.K. Rowling, the British author behind the Harry Potter series, had some choice words for Trump supporters who called her out on Twitter. - SHAUN CURRY/AFP/Getty Images Rowling wasted no time firing back at the disgruntled user, writing, "Guess it's true what they say: you can lead a girl to books about the rise and fall of an autocrat, but you still can't make her think."
And she didn't stop there.
Once stumbling upon another tweet from a former "Harry Potter" fan who said they would burn the books and movies, Rowling delivered another snappy reply.
"Well, the fumes from the DVDs might be toxic and I've still got your money, so by all means borrow my lighter," she wrote.
The 51-year-old has been an outspoken detractor of Donald Trump despite being a resident of England.
Her most recent tweet on Wednesday thanked her true fans for support after being barraged with hateful Tweets.
"I'd just like to thank everyone sending me lovely messages, which greatly outnumber the bad ones," she wrote, jokingly adding, "I'm now off to produce more kindling..."
